Authors: SANJEET KUMAR VERMA, SANJAY YADAV, RAGHVENDRA SINGH
Title:
Taxonomy and Phylogeny of Phytopathogenic Colletotrichum
lebbeckae and Colletotrichum oscimae from India
Keywords: biodiversity, asexual morph, plant disease, taxonomy
Abstract:
Two new interesting asexual foliicolous species,
Colletotrichum oscimae from living leaf of Ocimum tenuiflorum and
Colletotrichum lebbeckae, was discovered on pods of Albizia lebbeck
during the sample collection trip in Oct.Â 2019, in India is herein
described and illustrated. The phylogenetic tree of Colletotrichum
oscimae shows the close relation with Colletotrichum yulongense and
Colletotrichum gloeosporioides. The Colletotrichum lebbeckae show the
close relation with Colletotrichum fusiforme and Colletotrichum acidae
in the phylogeny. The both species are different to all closely related
species based on the phylogenetic analysis of ITS and LSU gene
sequences.
